Module com.example.demo
Package client

Class MoveBoard

java.lang.Object
client.MoveBoard
public class MoveBoard extends Object
The class regulates all about the board moves

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    protected static void
    blockPreviousStartPoint(javafx.geometry.Point2D prevPoint)
    Method that accepts the start point of the previous move and stores it to block making a step back in your turn.
    protected static void
    HidePreviousAvailibleMoves(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane pane)
    Hides previous available moves when the other point is chosen or the step is made and turn finished.
    protected static void
    ifHopped(javafx.geometry.Point2D endPoint, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane pane)
    The method checks if the hop was made by comparing starting and ending point on the board.
    protected static void
    RedrawBoardMove(javafx.geometry.Point2D startPoint, javafx.geometry.Point2D endPoint, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane pane, javafx.scene.paint.Color playerColor)
    When the points are approved by the server the start point is redrawn to be available for moves and the end point is set to the player`s color.
    protected static void
    setHoppedFalse()
    When hopped is true that means that the point made a hop and cannot make regular moves anymore.

  • Constructor Details

    • MoveBoard

      public MoveBoard()

  • Method Details

    • setHoppedFalse

      protected static void setHoppedFalse()
      When hopped is true that means that the point made a hop and cannot make regular moves anymore. Method makes possible to reset hopped when the player finishes his move, so he can make ordinary moves.

    • setTempPointNull

      protected static void setTempPointNull()
      Temporary point blocks the ability to go back to the previous step in this turn. Method gives the ability to clear the point after the turn is finished.

    • ifHopped

      protected static void ifHopped(javafx.geometry.Point2D endPoint, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane pane)
      The method checks if the hop was made by comparing starting and ending point on the board. If the hop was made makes @param hopped true. You cannot set hopped true by yourself.
      Parameters:
      endPoint - the point for comparing with the X and Y of the starting point stored inside the class.
      pane - game board

    • blockPreviousStartPoint

      protected static void blockPreviousStartPoint(javafx.geometry.Point2D prevPoint)
      Method that accepts the start point of the previous move and stores it to block making a step back in your turn.
      Parameters:
      prevPoint - previous start point

    • ShowAllAvailableMoves

      protected static void ShowAllAvailableMoves(javafx.geometry.Point2D startPoint, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane pane)
      Method shows available moves for the point clicked if it is of your color and it is your turn. After you make a step shows available steps only for the point chosen in the first step and only if it was a hop.
      Parameters:
      startPoint - the point that was clicked.
      pane - game board

    • HidePreviousAvailibleMoves

      protected static void HidePreviousAvailibleMoves(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane pane)
      Hides previous available moves when the other point is chosen or the step is made and turn finished.
      Parameters:
      pane - game board.

    • RedrawBoardMove

      protected static void RedrawBoardMove(javafx.geometry.Point2D startPoint, javafx.geometry.Point2D endPoint, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane pane, javafx.scene.paint.Color playerColor)
      When the points are approved by the server the start point is redrawn to be available for moves and the end point is set to the player`s color.
      Parameters:
      startPoint - move`s start point.
      endPoint - move`s endpoint.
      pane - game board.
      playerColor - the color of the player whose move it is.
